summary: Day was emotionally heavy. Call with Banvi brought unresolved patterns back into view — emotional mismatch, repeated conflict, and final clarity on incompatibility. Spent much of the day refracting emotionally and cleaning code. Cursor workflow felt misaligned, leading to frustration. Mood was low despite effort. Felt detached and irritable. No major forward push on SAM or SpendMirror; internal re-alignment dominated.

wins: Maintained emotional clarity during heated call — didn’t collapse or rescue.
Did internal cleanup of emotional identity and some code refactoring despite low mood.
losses: Cursor workflow felt ineffective due to lack of direction and prep.
Emotional residue from Banvi conversation impacted focus and execution.
ideas: Cursor only amplifies clarity — it doesn’t create it. Plan, then prompt.
Emotional truth isn’t emotional health. Process still needed after clarity.

goals: Do one tangible forward task on SAM v2 or SpendMirror (not cleanup).
Reassess Cursor workflow: define task better before opening session.
triggerEvents: Call with Banvi — emotional lash-out and realization of incompatibility
